channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Buyers are gaining the upper hand in a shifting housing market. ‘Everybody wants a deal.’
item.description: A shift is happening during the busiest season for the real-estate industry.

item.title: Surge in Treasury yields points to U.S. debt concerns as Trump’s tax bill advances. Investors want this fix.
item.description: There’s a list of things the White House could do to lower yields, but signing an executive order isn’t one of them, one portfolio manager said.

item.title: This investor banks on Munger’s advice to ride out volatility in markets and Tesla
item.description: Money manager Christopher Tsai says he pays scant attention to daily market ups and downs, except to look for stock opportunities.

item.title: Advance Auto Parts’ stock rockets as tariffs didn’t change the earnings outlook
item.description: On Thursday, the company said it’ll handle the extra costs tied to the current tariff regime and still deliver its full-year earnings targets.

item.title: My husband and I used joint funds to renovate and prepare his house for sale. Do I now own half?
item.description: “My name is not on the deed to that rental home, but we have been married 15 years.”

item.title: Thursday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: Stocks sold off sharply on Wednesday as bond yields climbed and traders' deficit fears intensified. Here's what's on CNBC's radar going into Thursday.

item.description: The cloud company posted first-quarter earnings and revenue that beat analyst expectations.

item.title: This fitness stock is a buy as sales momentum is set to continue, Stifel says
item.description: Analyst Chris O'Cull upgraded shares of the gym chain to buy from hold.

item.title: Bank of America downgrades this big-box retailer, cites margin and tariff pressures
item.description: Analyst Robert Ohmes downgraded the big-box retailer to neutral from buy and lowered his price target.

item.title: Chief investment strategist says these outperforming tech plays remain attractive
item.description: Eva Ados, COO and chief investment strategist at ER Shares, gave her bullish takes on a handful of stocks, including Tesla and Robinhood.
